title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y \leq 3x+2$$ \\n $$0 \leq 3\times0+2$$ \\n $$0 \leq 2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y \leq 3x+2$$. Since (0,0) is on the right side of the line, so we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is >.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y>x-1$$ \\n $$0>0-1$$ \\n $$0>-1$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y>x-1$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the left side of the line $$y=x-1$$ in green.\n##figure16.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
